dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, uh, interesting news out of Canada this week. It looks like they've actually *removed* a sanction, you know, from their list.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, uh, interesting news out of Canada this week. It looks like they've actually removed a sanction, you know, from their list.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Canada's Foreign Minister, Mlanie Joly, advised her government to remove businessman Oleg Boyko from the list of individuals previously sanctioned in connection with Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's right. For, um, Russian businessman Oleg Boyko. He was on Canada's sanctions list, like, since April 2022.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's right. For, um, Russian businessman Oleg Boyko. He was on Canada's sanctions list, like, since April twenty twenty two.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mr. Boyko was added to Canada's sanctions list in April 2022.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And he was sanctioned, of course, in connection with Russia's invasion of Ukraine. But his side, they, uh, they really disagreed with that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And he was sanctioned, of course, in connection with Russia's invasion of Ukraine. But his side, they, uh, they really disagreed with that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Canada's Foreign Minister, Mlanie Joly, advised her government to remove businessman Oleg Boyko from the list of individuals previously sanctioned in connection with Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The businessman's side disagreed with the restrictions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. So, what happened is, in August last year, Boyko actually filed a lawsuit against the Canadian Foreign Ministry. [interrupts] Like, in Federal Court.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. So, what happened is, in August last year, Boyko actually filed a lawsuit against the Canadian Foreign Ministry. Like, in Federal Court.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In August 2023, Oleg Boyko filed a lawsuit against the Canadian Foreign Ministry in the Federal Court of Canada.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Wow, okay, so he took them to court. And what was their main argument?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, okay, so he took them to court. And what was their main argument?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, his lawyers insisted, uh, he has no business in Canada at all. And, you know, he's not associated with Russian authorities or involved in political decision-making.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, his lawyers insisted, uh, he has no business in Canada at all. And, you know, he's not associated with Russian authorities or involved in political decision-making.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The applicant's lawyers insisted that Mr. Boyko has no business in Canada, and he is not associated with the authorities and state bodies of Russia, and does not participate in Russia's political decision-making.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I see. So, Mélanie Joly, Canada's Foreign Minister, she, uh, she actually reviewed this appeal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I see. So, Mélanie Joly, Canada's Foreign Minister, she, uh, she actually reviewed this appeal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the end, Canada's Foreign Minister, Mlanie Joly, authorized to consider matters of imposing and lifting sanctions in accordance with national legislation, reviewed the appeal and decided to grant it...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: She did. And she decided to grant it. They notified him back in November, um, November 10th, 2023.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: She did. And she decided to grant it. They notified him back in November, um, November tenth, twenty twenty three.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...reviewed the appeal and decided to grant it, notifying the applicant in a letter dated November 10, 2023.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And then they officially announced it, like, on their government website just a few days later, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then they officially announced it, like, on their government website just a few days later, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On November 15, a statement was published on the Canadian government's website indicating that Item 731 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Special Economic Measures (Russia) Regulations is repealed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. They just repealed that specific item, uh, Item 731, that included him. So, he's off the list now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. They just repealed that specific item, uh, Item seven hundred thirty one, that included him. So, he's off the list now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On November 15, a statement was published on the Canadian government's website indicating that Item 731 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Special Economic Measures (Russia) Regulations is repealed. This section includes Oleg Viktorovich Boyko, born on September 28, 1964.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's pretty significant. His lawyer, uh, I saw a comment, said they're pleased because it shows a 'balanced and fair stance' for businessmen unrelated to politics.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's pretty significant. His lawyer, uh, I saw a comment, said they're pleased because it shows a balanced and fair stance for businessmen unrelated to politics.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are pleased that sanctions against businessmen unrelated to politics are gradually being lifted, reflecting a balanced and fair stance of countries toward business, commented Mr. Boyko's lawyer on the decision of the Canadian authorities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's, like, a pretty strong statement from his legal team. And, you know, Boyko himself, he's the founder of Finstar Financial Group. They're huge, operating in 25 countries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's, like, a pretty strong statement from his legal team. And, you know, Boyko himself, he's the founder of Finstar Financial Group. They're huge, operating in twenty five countries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Oleg Boyko is the founder and chairman of the supervisory board of Finstar Financial Group, engaged in investment activities in 25 countries worldwide...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, not just a small player then. And I hear they're even working on lifting sanctions in Australia now too?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, not just a small player then. And I hear they're even working on lifting sanctions in Australia now too?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Mr. Boyko's lawyer, work is currently underway to lift sanctions in Australia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's what his lawyer said. So, uh, Canada might just be the first domino here, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's what his lawyer said. So, uh, Canada might just be the first domino here, you know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. Interesting to see if other countries follow suit, especially for those who argue they're not directly tied to the conflict.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. Interesting to see if other countries follow suit, especially for those who argue they're not directly tied to the conflict.

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it sets a precedent, for sure. It'll be interesting to watch.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it sets a precedent, for sure. It'll be interesting to watch.
